PropertyDef.Name: LineationType
PropertyDef.Definition: Flow lines, scratches, striae, slickenlines, linear arrangements of elongate components in sediments, elongate minerals, crinkles, and lines of intersection between penetrative planar structures.

PropertyDef.Name: DefiningElement
PropertyDef.Definition: Kinds of describable inhomogeneity in a rock body that may define a geologic structure. Examples include oriented particle.

PropertyDef.Name: DipDirection
PropertyDef.Definition: The geographic direction of a line created by the intersection of a plane and the horizontal plane. If non specific convention is used, this angular value is in the range 0 to 180 degrees. In this case, there is an ambiguity on the dip orientation. For example, a plane with an orientation of 90 degrees from the north could either have a dip direction to the North or to the South. Thus, to avoid this ambiguity, a strike value is generally completed with an indication of the dip orientation (Quadrant).

PropertyDef.Name: Plunge
PropertyDef.Definition: The angle of inclination of the fold axis with the horizontal as measured in a vertical plane.

PropertyDef.Name: DeformationPhase
PropertyDef.Definition: Name or label for a geologic event such as a basin formation, compressional tectonic phase, orogeny etc.
